definition: victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)

sentences.english: It is survival of the fittest, may great music win.
sentences.chinese: 這是優勝劣汰，願偉大的音樂得勝。

sentences.english: Fortunately, industry changes in recent years, the phenomenon of survival of the fittest is taking place.
sentences.chinese: 還好近幾年行業在變革，優勝劣汰的的現象正在發生。

sentences.english: The market is constrictive the effect that also can have superior bad discard to the industry.
sentences.chinese: 市場緊縮也能夠對行業起到優勝劣汰的作用。

sentences.english: This year looks set to help separate the sheep from the goats in China's property sector.
sentences.chinese: 今年中國房地產企業極有可能展開優勝劣汰。

sentences.english: At the same time, it also laid emphasis on the selection and appointment of teachers that is done through competition.
sentences.chinese: 同時，也注重對太學教師的選拔和任用，優勝劣汰。

sentences.english: Information market has paid more attention to fair competition and survival of the fittest.
sentences.chinese: 信息市場政策注重於公平競爭和優勝劣汰。
